Body: Yes, enabling the XMP (or DOCP) profile is standard procedure! It simply loads the manufacturer's tested settings for that speed. There's generally no risk.
The only 'risk' is if your CPU's memory controller is very old or unstable, but for modern CPUs, you should be fine. It's a single-click performance boost.
Just make sure your BIOS is updated before trying it!
